intro: Crinum lastii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved crinum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink, trumpet-shaped blooms that appear in summer. Crinum lastii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial shade. It is also known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful if ingested.
